intro: Uvaria andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman satinash, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically yellow or red when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
